subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit Test Result Format" (XML): No evolution for years?
msgSnippet: ... It depends on what you mean by maintained. ... This is true (I m one of the initial authors of XMLJUnitResultFormatter).  Not exactly one time since the
messageBody:
On 2010-09-17, Daniela Waranie wrote:

>> My questions are these, is JUnit responsible for this specification?

> It seams that the 'specification', that was introduced by the ant team,
> is not maintained anymore by the ant team.

It depends on what you mean by maintained.

> It seams that the 'specification' was a one time ejection of the ant
> team.

This is true (I'm one of the initial authors of
XMLJUnitResultFormatter). Not exactly "one time" since the format
evolved a bit, but then again it has been ten years since we've
initially created it and the format has been stable for nine years or so
now.

> I think my next step should be to contact the ant team as they are the
> legal 'copyright owner' (in the open source meaning) of the
> XMLJUnitResultFormatter code.

You are welcome (the most easy way from Ant's POV would certainly be a
different formatter).

> Any suggestions who to contact and how to contact ?

dev@...

But this would only give you Ant tooling support for whatever new format
would be created. I agree that it would be benefitial to a new format
if it wasn't decided on by a single tool but on some more "neutral
ground".

Stefan
